Bootstrapping

Method: (Bootstrapping)

  1. From the original sample generate an estimator
  2. Take a random sample of the same size n from the original sample with replacement, and form a new sample , get an estimator
  3. Repeat step 2 and form a new sample , get estimators
  4. Compute the distribution with the estimators
  5. Use the distribution calculated above to do Hypothesis Test or give the Confidence Interval

Claim: (Bootstrapping Theory) When the time bootstrapping repeats increases, the bootstrapping distribution converges to the distribution of the real estimator.
